title: Tennis Racquet and Ball

verbs: To perform in (a sport); to participate in (a game).
To take part in a sport's match.
nouns: Round object
Object, generally spherical, used for playing games.
A ball is a round, usually spherical but sometimes ovoid, object with various uses.
Round object that is hit or thrown or kicked in games
An object, generally spherical, used for playing games.
Sport in which individuals or teams attempt to ground the ball on the opponent's side of the net
Sport played by two or four players with strung racquets.
A game played with rackets by two or four players who hit a ball back and forth over a net that divides the court
A sport played by two players (or four in doubles), who alternately strike the ball over a net using racquets.
A sport played by either two or four players with strung raquets, a 2-1/2" (6.4 centimetres) ball, and a net approximately 3 feet high on a clay, grass, or cement court.
Tennis is a racquet sport that can be played individually against a single opponent or between two teams of two players each.
Tennis is a game played between either two players or two teams of two players.
Ball used in the sport of tennis
A bouncy ball designed for the sport of tennis. A rubber, hollow ball, pressurized and covered with felt. Most common color is "Optic Yellow", but many colors exist today.
Ball about the size of a fist used in playing tennis
A tennis ball is a ball designed for the sport of tennis.
Ball for tennis.
In general (sport)
An implement with a handle connected to a round frame strung with wire, sinew, or plastic cords, and used to hit a ball, such as in tennis, or a shuttlecock in badminton.
A racquet: an implement with a handle connected to a round frame strung with wire, sinew, or plastic cords, and used to hit a ball, such as in tennis or a birdie in badminton.
A piece of equipment used to play tennis, badminton, squash, racquetball and other sports
A sports implement (usually consisting of a handle and an oval frame with a tightly interlaced network of strings) used to strike a ball (or shuttlecock) in various games
An implement with a handle connected to a round frame strung with wire, sinew, or plastic cords, and used to hit a ball, such as in tennis or a birdie in badminton.
A racket or racquet is a sports implement consisting of a handled frame with an open hoop across which a network of cord is stretched tightly.
An implement with a handle used to hit a ball.

description: A tennis racket (racquet) with a tennis ball. Only a ball is shown on certain platforms, including Apple, Twitter, and WhatsApp.
apple_vendor_description: The tennis emoji on Apple devices showcases a vibrant yellow tennis ball, rendered with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading that makes it appear perfectly round and ready for a match.  Its surface exhibits subtle texture and realistic lighting, hinting at the felt fibers and the dynamic motion of the sport. This emoji is a clear and energetic symbol for sports, competition, and active leisure, easily conveying enthusiasm for tennis or a general love of athletic pursuits on Apple devices.
